statement.p: Real eigenvalues of A are defined as the real numbers \lambda such that (A-\lambda I_n)x = 0 has a nonzero real solution x. Explain why eigenvalues are precisely the real roots of \det(A-\lambda I_n), the characteristic polynomial of A. What do nonreal roots of \det(A-\lambda I_n) correspond to?
Why do eigenvalues of a triangular matrix (a_{ij}) are its entries on the main diagonal, that is, a_{11}, \cdots , a_{nn}? Is this true for non-triangular matrix?
